stimulusHtml: A sphere is attached to a vertical spring and oscillates in simple harmonic motion. The sphere’s displacement x from equilibrium is described by the differential equation d2xdt2=−C1x, where t is the time and C1 is a positive constant. In a second setup with a different sphere and a different spring, the oscillation frequency is higher than in the original setup. For the second setup, how is the differential equation describing the motion different, if at all, from that of the first setup?
choicesHtml: A different constant greater than C1 is used.
A different constant less than C1 is used.
An additional constant is added to the right-hand side of the equation.
